10362  set_manifold(p.first, *p.second);
10363 
10364 
10365  levels.reserve(other_tria.levels.size());
10366  for (unsigned int level = 0; level < other_tria.levels.size(); ++level)
10367  levels.push_back(
10368  std::make_unique<internal::TriangulationImplementation::TriaLevel>(
10369  *other_tria.levels[level]));
10370 
10371  number_cache = other_tria.number_cache;
10372 
10373  if (dim == 1)
10374  {
10375  vertex_to_boundary_id_map_1d =
10376  std::make_unique<std::map<unsigned int, types::boundary_id>>(
10377  *other_tria.vertex_to_boundary_id_map_1d);
10378 
10379  vertex_to_manifold_id_map_1d =
10380  std::make_unique<std::map<unsigned int, types::manifold_id>>(
10381  *other_tria.vertex_to_manifold_id_map_1d);
10382  }
10383 
10384  if (other_tria.policy)
10385  this->policy = other_tria.policy->clone();
10386 
10387  // inform those who are listening on other_tria of the copy operation
10388  other_tria.signals.copy(*this);
10389  // also inform all listeners of the current triangulation that the
10390  // triangulation has been created
10391  signals.create();
10392 
10393  // note that we need not copy the
10394  // subscriptor!
10395 }
10396 
10397 
10398 
10399 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10400 void
10401 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::create_triangulation_compatibility(
10402  const std::vector<Point<spacedim>> &v,
10403  const std::vector<CellData<dim>> & cells,
10404  const SubCellData & subcelldata)
10405 {
10406  std::vector<CellData<dim>> reordered_cells(cells); // NOLINT
10407  SubCellData reordered_subcelldata(subcelldata); // NOLINT
10408 
10409  // in-place reordering of data
10410  reorder_compatibility(reordered_cells, reordered_subcelldata);
10411 
10412  // now create triangulation from
10413  // reordered data
10414  create_triangulation(v, reordered_cells, reordered_subcelldata);
10415 }
10416 
10417 
10418 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10419 void
10420 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::reset_policy()
10421 {
10422  this->update_reference_cells();
10423 
10424  if (this->all_reference_cells_are_hyper_cube())
10425  {
10426  this->policy =
10427  std::make_unique<internal::TriangulationImplementation::PolicyWrapper<
10428  dim,
10429  spacedim,
10430  internal::TriangulationImplementation::Implementation>>();
10431  }
10432  else
10433  {
10434  this->policy =
10435  std::make_unique<internal::TriangulationImplementation::PolicyWrapper<
10436  dim,
10437  spacedim,
10438  internal::TriangulationImplementation::ImplementationMixedMesh>>();
10439  }
10440 }
10441 
10442 
10443 
10444 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10445 void
10446 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::create_triangulation(
10447  const std::vector<Point<spacedim>> &v,
10448  const std::vector<CellData<dim>> & cells,
10449  const SubCellData & subcelldata)
10450 {
10451  Assert((vertices.size() == 0) && (levels.size() == 0) && (faces == nullptr),
10452  ExcTriangulationNotEmpty(vertices.size(), levels.size()));
10453  // check that no forbidden arrays
10454  // are used
10455  Assert(subcelldata.check_consistency(dim), ExcInternalError());
10456 
10457  // try to create a triangulation; if this fails, we still want to
10458  // throw an exception but if we just do so we'll get into trouble
10459  // because sometimes other objects are already attached to it:
10460  try
10461  {
10462  internal::TriangulationImplementation::Implementation::
10463  create_triangulation(v, cells, subcelldata, *this);
10464  }
10465  catch (...)
10466  {
10467  clear_despite_subscriptions();
10468  throw;
10469  }
10470 
10471  reset_policy();
10472 
10473  // update our counts of the various elements of a triangulation, and set
10474  // active_cell_indices of all cells
10475  reset_cell_vertex_indices_cache();
10476  internal::TriangulationImplementation::Implementation::compute_number_cache(
10477  *this, levels.size(), number_cache);
10478  reset_active_cell_indices();
10479  reset_global_cell_indices();
10480 
10481  // now verify that there are indeed no distorted cells. as per the
10482  // documentation of this class, we first collect all distorted cells
10483  // and then throw an exception if there are any
10484  if (check_for_distorted_cells)
10485  {
10486  DistortedCellList distorted_cells = collect_distorted_coarse_cells(*this);
10487  // throw the array (and fill the various location fields) if
10488  // there are distorted cells. otherwise, just fall off the end
10489  // of the function
10490  AssertThrow(distorted_cells.distorted_cells.size() == 0, distorted_cells);
10491  }
10492 
10493 
10494  /*
10495  When the triangulation is a manifold (dim < spacedim), the normal field
10496  provided from the map class depends on the order of the vertices.
10497  It may happen that this normal field is discontinuous.
10498  The following code takes care that this is not the case by setting the
10499  cell direction flag on those cell that produce the wrong orientation.
10500 
10501  To determine if 2 neighbours have the same or opposite orientation
10502  we use a table of truth.
10503  Its entries are indexes by the local indices of the common face.
10504  For example if two elements share a face, and this face is
10505  face 0 for element 0 and face 1 for element 1, then
10506  table(0,1) will tell whether the orientation are the same (true) or
10507  opposite (false).
10508 
10509  Even though there may be a combinatorial/graph theory argument to get
10510  this table in any dimension, I tested by hand all the different possible
10511  cases in 1D and 2D to generate the table.
10512 
10513  Assuming that a surface respects the standard orientation for 2d meshes,
10514  the tables of truth are symmetric and their true values are the following
10515  1D curves: (0,1)
10516  2D surface: (0,1),(0,2),(1,3),(2,3)
10517 
10518  We store this data using an n_faces x n_faces full matrix, which is
10519  actually much bigger than the minimal data required, but it makes the code
10520  more readable.
10521 
10522  */
10523  if (dim < spacedim)
10524  {
10525  Table<2, bool> correct(GeometryInfo<dim>::faces_per_cell,
10526  GeometryInfo<dim>::faces_per_cell);
10527  switch (dim)
10528  {
10529  case 1:
10530  {
10531  bool values[][2] = {{false, true}, {true, false}};
10532  for (const unsigned int i : GeometryInfo<dim>::face_indices())
10533  for (const unsigned int j : GeometryInfo<dim>::face_indices())
10534  correct(i, j) = (values[i][j]);
10535  break;
10536  }
10537  case 2:
10538  {
10539  bool values[][4] = {{false, true, true, false},
10540  {true, false, false, true},
10541  {true, false, false, true},
10542  {false, true, true, false}};
10543  for (const unsigned int i : GeometryInfo<dim>::face_indices())
10544  for (const unsigned int j : GeometryInfo<dim>::face_indices())
10545  correct(i, j) = (values[i][j]);
10546  break;
10547  }
10548  default:
10549  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
10550  }
10551 
10552 
10553  std::list<active_cell_iterator> this_round, next_round;
10554  active_cell_iterator neighbor;
10555 
10556  this_round.push_back(begin_active());
10557  begin_active()->set_direction_flag(true);
10558  begin_active()->set_user_flag();
10559 
10560  while (this_round.size() > 0)
10561  {
10562  for (typename std::list<active_cell_iterator>::iterator cell =
10563  this_round.begin();
10564  cell != this_round.end();
10565  ++cell)
10566  {
10567  for (const unsigned int i : (*cell)->face_indices())
10568  {
10569  if (!((*cell)->face(i)->at_boundary()))
10570  {
10571  neighbor = (*cell)->neighbor(i);
10572 
10573  unsigned int cf = (*cell)->face_index(i);
10574  unsigned int j = 0;
10575  while (neighbor->face_index(j) != cf)
10576  {
10577  ++j;
10578  }
10579 
10580 
10581  // If we already saw this guy, check that everything is
10582  // fine
10583  if (neighbor->user_flag_set())
10584  {
10585  // If we have visited this guy, then the ordering and
10586  // the orientation should agree
10587  Assert(!(correct(i, j) ^
10588  (neighbor->direction_flag() ==
10589  (*cell)->direction_flag())),
10590  ExcNonOrientableTriangulation());
10591  }
10592  else
10593  {
10594  next_round.push_back(neighbor);
10595  neighbor->set_user_flag();
10596  if ((correct(i, j) ^ (neighbor->direction_flag() ==
10597  (*cell)->direction_flag())))
10598  neighbor->set_direction_flag(
10599  !neighbor->direction_flag());
10600  }
10601  }
10602  }
10603  }
10604 
10605  // Before we quit let's check
10606  // that if the triangulation
10607  // is disconnected that we
10608  // still get all cells
10609  if (next_round.size() == 0)
10610  for (const auto &cell : this->active_cell_iterators())
10611  if (cell->user_flag_set() == false)
10612  {
10613  next_round.push_back(cell);
10614  cell->set_direction_flag(true);
10615  cell->set_user_flag();
10616  break;
10617  }
10618 
10619  this_round = next_round;
10620  next_round.clear();
10621  }
10622  }
10623 
10624  // inform all listeners that the triangulation has been created
10625  signals.create();
10626 }
10627 
10628 
10629 
10630 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10631 void
10632 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::create_triangulation(
10633  const TriangulationDescription::Description<dim, spacedim> &construction_data)
10634 {
10635  // 1) create coarse grid
10636  create_triangulation(construction_data.coarse_cell_vertices,
10637  construction_data.coarse_cells,
10638  SubCellData());
10639 
10640  // create a copy of cell_infos such that we can sort them
10641  auto cell_infos = construction_data.cell_infos;
10642 
10643  // sort cell_infos on each level separately
10644  for (auto &cell_info : cell_infos)
10645  std::sort(
10646  cell_info.begin(),
10647  cell_info.end(),
10648  [&](TriangulationDescription::CellData<dim> a,
10649  TriangulationDescription::CellData<dim> b) {
10650  const CellId a_id(a.id);
10651  const CellId b_id(b.id);
10652 
10653  const auto a_coarse_cell_index =
10654  this->coarse_cell_id_to_coarse_cell_index(a_id.get_coarse_cell_id());
10655  const auto b_coarse_cell_index =
10656  this->coarse_cell_id_to_coarse_cell_index(b_id.get_coarse_cell_id());
10657 
10658  // according to their coarse-cell index and if that is
10659  // same according to their cell id (the result is that
10660  // cells on each level are sorted according to their
10661  // index on that level - what we need in the following
10662  // operations)
10663  if (a_coarse_cell_index != b_coarse_cell_index)
10664  return a_coarse_cell_index < b_coarse_cell_index;
10665  else
10666  return a_id < b_id;
10667  });
10668 
10669  // 2) create all levels via a sequence of refinements. note that
10670  // we must make sure that we actually have cells on this level,
10671  // which is not clear in a parallel context for some processes
10672  for (unsigned int level = 0;
10673  level < cell_infos.size() && !cell_infos[level].empty();
10674  ++level)
10675  {
10676  // a) set manifold ids here (because new vertices have to be
10677  // positioned correctly during each refinement step)
10678  {
10679  auto cell = this->begin(level);
10680  auto cell_info = cell_infos[level].begin();
10681  for (; cell_info != cell_infos[level].end(); ++cell_info)
10682  {
10683  while (cell_info->id != cell->id().template to_binary<dim>())
10684  ++cell;
10685  if (dim == 3)
10686  for (const auto quad : cell->face_indices())
10687  cell->quad(quad)->set_manifold_id(
10688  cell_info->manifold_quad_ids[quad]);
10689 
10690  if (dim >= 2)
10691  for (const auto line : cell->line_indices())
10692  cell->line(line)->set_manifold_id(
10693  cell_info->manifold_line_ids[line]);
10694 
10695  cell->set_manifold_id(cell_info->manifold_id);
10696  }
10697  }
10698 
10699  // b) perform refinement on all levels but on the finest
10700  if (level + 1 != cell_infos.size())
10701  {
10702  // find cells that should have children and mark them for
10703  // refinement
10704  auto coarse_cell = this->begin(level);
10705  auto fine_cell_info = cell_infos[level + 1].begin();
10706 
10707  // loop over all cells on the next level
10708  for (; fine_cell_info != cell_infos[level + 1].end();
10709  ++fine_cell_info)
10710  {
10711  // find the parent of that cell
10712  while (
10713  !coarse_cell->id().is_parent_of(CellId(fine_cell_info->id)))
10714  ++coarse_cell;
10715 
10716  // set parent for refinement
10717  coarse_cell->set_refine_flag();
10718  }
10719 
10720  // execute refinement
10721  ::Triangulation<dim,
10722  spacedim>::execute_coarsening_and_refinement();
10723  }
10724  }
10725 
10726  // 3) set boundary ids
10727  for (unsigned int level = 0;
10728  level < cell_infos.size() && !cell_infos[level].empty();
10729  ++level)
10730  {
10731  auto cell = this->begin(level);
10732  auto cell_info = cell_infos[level].begin();
10733  for (; cell_info != cell_infos[level].end(); ++cell_info)
10734  {
10735  // find cell that has the correct cell
10736  while (cell_info->id != cell->id().template to_binary<dim>())
10737  ++cell;
10738 
10739  // boundary ids
10740  for (auto pair : cell_info->boundary_ids)
10741  {
10742  Assert(cell->at_boundary(pair.first),
10743  ExcMessage("Cell face is not on the boundary!"));
10744  cell->face(pair.first)->set_boundary_id(pair.second);
10745  }
10746  }
10747  }
10748 }
10749 
10750 
10751 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10752 void
10753 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::flip_all_direction_flags()
10754 {
10755  AssertThrow(dim + 1 == spacedim,
10756  ExcMessage("Only works for dim == spacedim-1"));
10757  for (const auto &cell : this->active_cell_iterators())
10758  cell->set_direction_flag(!cell->direction_flag());
10759 }
10760 
10761 
10762 
10763 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10764 void
10765 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::set_all_refine_flags()
10766 {
10767  Assert(n_cells() > 0,
10768  ExcMessage("Error: An empty Triangulation can not be refined."));
10769 
10770  for (const auto &cell : this->active_cell_iterators())
10771  {
10772  cell->clear_coarsen_flag();
10773  cell->set_refine_flag();
10774  }
10775 }
10776 
10777 
10778 
10779 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10780 void
10781 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::refine_global(const unsigned int times)
10782 {
10783  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < times; ++i)
10784  {
10785  set_all_refine_flags();
10786  execute_coarsening_and_refinement();
10787  }
10788 }
10789 
10790 
10791 
10792 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10793 void
10794 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::coarsen_global(const unsigned int times)
10795 {
10796  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < times; ++i)
10797  {
10798  for (const auto &cell : this->active_cell_iterators())
10799  {
10800  cell->clear_refine_flag();
10801  cell->set_coarsen_flag();
10802  }
10803  execute_coarsening_and_refinement();
10804  }
10805 }
10806 
10807 
10808 /*-------------------- refine/coarsen flags -------------------------*/
10809 
10810 
10811 
10812 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10813 void
10814 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_refine_flags(std::vector<bool> &v) const
10815 {
10816  v.resize(dim * n_active_cells(), false);
10817  std::vector<bool>::iterator i = v.begin();
10818 
10819  for (const auto &cell : this->active_cell_iterators())
10820  for (unsigned int j = 0; j < dim; ++j, ++i)
10821  if (cell->refine_flag_set() & (1 << j))
10822  *i = true;
10823 
10824  Assert(i == v.end(), ExcInternalError());
10825 }
10826 
10827 
10828 
10829 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10830 void
10831 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_refine_flags(std::ostream &out) const
10832 {
10833  std::vector<bool> v;
10834  save_refine_flags(v);
10835  write_bool_vector(mn_tria_refine_flags_begin,
10836  v,
10837  mn_tria_refine_flags_end,
10838  out);
10839 }
10840 
10841 
10842 
10843 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10844 void
10845 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_refine_flags(std::istream &in)
10846 {
10847  std::vector<bool> v;
10848  read_bool_vector(mn_tria_refine_flags_begin, v, mn_tria_refine_flags_end, in);
10849  load_refine_flags(v);
10850 }
10851 
10852 
10853 
10854 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10855 void
10856 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_refine_flags(const std::vector<bool> &v)
10857 {
10858  AssertThrow(v.size() == dim * n_active_cells(), ExcGridReadError());
10859 
10860  std::vector<bool>::const_iterator i = v.begin();
10861  for (const auto &cell : this->active_cell_iterators())
10862  {
10863  unsigned int ref_case = 0;
10864 
10865  for (unsigned int j = 0; j < dim; ++j, ++i)
10866  if (*i == true)
10867  ref_case += 1 << j;
10868  Assert(ref_case < RefinementCase<dim>::isotropic_refinement + 1,
10869  ExcGridReadError());
10870  if (ref_case > 0)
10871  cell->set_refine_flag(RefinementCase<dim>(ref_case));
10872  else
10873  cell->clear_refine_flag();
10874  }
10875 
10876  Assert(i == v.end(), ExcInternalError());
10877 }
10878 
10879 
10880 
10881 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10882 void
10883 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_coarsen_flags(std::vector<bool> &v) const
10884 {
10885  v.resize(n_active_cells(), false);
10886  std::vector<bool>::iterator i = v.begin();
10887  for (const auto &cell : this->active_cell_iterators())
10888  {
10889  *i = cell->coarsen_flag_set();
10890  ++i;
10891  }
10892 
10893  Assert(i == v.end(), ExcInternalError());
10894 }
10895 
10896 
10897 
10898 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10899 void
10900 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_coarsen_flags(std::ostream &out) const
10901 {
10902  std::vector<bool> v;
10903  save_coarsen_flags(v);
10904  write_bool_vector(mn_tria_coarsen_flags_begin,
10905  v,
10906  mn_tria_coarsen_flags_end,
10907  out);
10908 }
10909 
10910 
10911 
10912 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10913 void
10914 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_coarsen_flags(std::istream &in)
10915 {
10916  std::vector<bool> v;
10917  read_bool_vector(mn_tria_coarsen_flags_begin,
10918  v,
10919  mn_tria_coarsen_flags_end,
10920  in);
10921  load_coarsen_flags(v);
10922 }
10923 
10924 
10925 
10926 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10927 void
10928 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_coarsen_flags(const std::vector<bool> &v)
10929 {
10930  Assert(v.size() == n_active_cells(), ExcGridReadError());
10931 
10932  std::vector<bool>::const_iterator i = v.begin();
10933  for (const auto &cell : this->active_cell_iterators())
10934  {
10935  if (*i == true)
10936  cell->set_coarsen_flag();
10937  else
10938  cell->clear_coarsen_flag();
10939  ++i;
10940  }
10941 
10942  Assert(i == v.end(), ExcInternalError());
10943 }
10944 
10945 
10946 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10947 bool
10948 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::get_anisotropic_refinement_flag() const
10949 {
10950  return anisotropic_refinement;
10951 }
10952 
10953 
10954 
10955 /*-------------------- user data/flags -------------------------*/
10956 
10957 
10958 namespace
10959 {
10960  // clear user data of cells
10961  void
10962  clear_user_data(std::vector<std::unique_ptr<
10963  internal::TriangulationImplementation::TriaLevel>> &levels)
10964  {
10965  for (auto &level : levels)
10966  level->cells.clear_user_data();
10967  }
10968 
10969 
10970  // clear user data of faces
10971  void
10972  clear_user_data(internal::TriangulationImplementation::TriaFaces *faces)
10973  {
10974  if (faces->dim == 2)
10975  {
10976  faces->lines.clear_user_data();
10977  }
10978 
10979 
10980  if (faces->dim == 3)
10981  {
10982  faces->lines.clear_user_data();
10983  faces->quads.clear_user_data();
10984  }
10985  }
10986 } // namespace
10987 
10988 
10989 template <int dim, int spacedim>
10990 void
10991 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::clear_user_data()
10992 {
10993  // let functions in anonymous namespace do their work
10994  ::clear_user_data(levels);
10995  if (dim > 1)
10996  ::clear_user_data(faces.get());
10997 }
10998 
10999 
11000 
11001 namespace
11002 {
11003  void
11004  clear_user_flags_line(
11005  unsigned int dim,
11006  std::vector<
11007  std::unique_ptr<internal::TriangulationImplementation::TriaLevel>>
11008  & levels,
11009  internal::TriangulationImplementation::TriaFaces *faces)
11010  {
11011  if (dim == 1)
11012  {
11013  for (const auto &level : levels)
11014  level->cells.clear_user_flags();
11015  }
11016  else if (dim == 2 || dim == 3)
11017  {
11018  faces->lines.clear_user_flags();
11019  }
11020  else
11021  {
11022  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented())
11023  }
11024  }
11025 } // namespace
11026 
11027 
11028 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11029 void
11030 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::clear_user_flags_line()
11031 {
11032  ::clear_user_flags_line(dim, levels, faces.get());
11033 }
11034 
11035 
11036 
11037 namespace
11038 {
11039  void
11040  clear_user_flags_quad(
11041  unsigned int dim,
11042  std::vector<
11043  std::unique_ptr<internal::TriangulationImplementation::TriaLevel>>
11044  & levels,
11045  internal::TriangulationImplementation::TriaFaces *faces)
11046  {
11047  if (dim == 1)
11048  {
11049  // nothing to do in 1d
11050  }
11051  else if (dim == 2)
11052  {
11053  for (const auto &level : levels)
11054  level->cells.clear_user_flags();
11055  }
11056  else if (dim == 3)
11057  {
11058  faces->quads.clear_user_flags();
11059  }
11060  else
11061  {
11062  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented())
11063  }
11064  }
11065 } // namespace
11066 
11067 
11068 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11069 void
11070 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::clear_user_flags_quad()
11071 {
11072  ::clear_user_flags_quad(dim, levels, faces.get());
11073 }
11074 
11075 
11076 
11077 namespace
11078 {
11079  void
11080  clear_user_flags_hex(
11081  unsigned int dim,
11082  std::vector<
11083  std::unique_ptr<internal::TriangulationImplementation::TriaLevel>>
11084  &levels,
11085  internal::TriangulationImplementation::TriaFaces *)
11086  {
11087  if (dim == 1)
11088  {
11089  // nothing to do in 1d
11090  }
11091  else if (dim == 2)
11092  {
11093  // nothing to do in 2d
11094  }
11095  else if (dim == 3)
11096  {
11097  for (const auto &level : levels)
11098  level->cells.clear_user_flags();
11099  }
11100  else
11101  {
11102  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented())
11103  }
11104  }
11105 } // namespace
11106 
11107 
11108 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11109 void
11110 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::clear_user_flags_hex()
11111 {
11112  ::clear_user_flags_hex(dim, levels, faces.get());
11113 }
11114 
11115 
11116 
11117 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11118 void
11119 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::clear_user_flags()
11120 {
11121  clear_user_flags_line();
11122  clear_user_flags_quad();
11123  clear_user_flags_hex();
11124 }
11125 
11126 
11127 
11128 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11129 void
11130 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_flags(std::ostream &out) const
11131 {
11132  save_user_flags_line(out);
11133 
11134  if (dim >= 2)
11135  save_user_flags_quad(out);
11136 
11137  if (dim >= 3)
11138  save_user_flags_hex(out);
11139 
11140  if (dim >= 4)
11141  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
11142 }
11143 
11144 
11145 
11146 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11147 void
11148 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_flags(std::vector<bool> &v) const
11149 {
11150  // clear vector and append
11151  // all the stuff later on
11152  v.clear();
11153 
11154  std::vector<bool> tmp;
11155 
11156  save_user_flags_line(tmp);
11157  v.insert(v.end(), tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
11158 
11159  if (dim >= 2)
11160  {
11161  save_user_flags_quad(tmp);
11162  v.insert(v.end(), tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
11163  }
11164 
11165  if (dim >= 3)
11166  {
11167  save_user_flags_hex(tmp);
11168  v.insert(v.end(), tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
11169  }
11170 
11171  if (dim >= 4)
11172  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
11173 }
11174 
11175 
11176 
11177 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11178 void
11179 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_flags(std::istream &in)
11180 {
11181  load_user_flags_line(in);
11182 
11183  if (dim >= 2)
11184  load_user_flags_quad(in);
11185 
11186  if (dim >= 3)
11187  load_user_flags_hex(in);
11188 
11189  if (dim >= 4)
11190  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
11191 }
11192 
11193 
11194 
11195 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11196 void
11197 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_flags(const std::vector<bool> &v)
11198 {
11199  Assert(v.size() == n_lines() + n_quads() + n_hexs(), ExcInternalError());
11200  std::vector<bool> tmp;
11201 
11202  // first extract the flags
11203  // belonging to lines
11204  tmp.insert(tmp.end(), v.begin(), v.begin() + n_lines());
11205  // and set the lines
11206  load_user_flags_line(tmp);
11207 
11208  if (dim >= 2)
11209  {
11210  tmp.clear();
11211  tmp.insert(tmp.end(),
11212  v.begin() + n_lines(),
11213  v.begin() + n_lines() + n_quads());
11214  load_user_flags_quad(tmp);
11215  }
11216 
11217  if (dim >= 3)
11218  {
11219  tmp.clear();
11220  tmp.insert(tmp.end(),
11221  v.begin() + n_lines() + n_quads(),
11222  v.begin() + n_lines() + n_quads() + n_hexs());
11223  load_user_flags_hex(tmp);
11224  }
11225 
11226  if (dim >= 4)
11227  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
11228 }
11229 
11230 
11231 
11232 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11233 void
11234 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_flags_line(std::vector<bool> &v) const
11235 {
11236  v.resize(n_lines(), false);
11237  std::vector<bool>::iterator i = v.begin();
11238  line_iterator line = begin_line(), endl = end_line();
11239  for (; line != endl; ++line, ++i)
11240  *i = line->user_flag_set();
11241 
11242  Assert(i == v.end(), ExcInternalError());
11243 }
11244 
11245 
11246 
11247 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11248 void
11249 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_flags_line(std::ostream &out) const
11250 {
11251  std::vector<bool> v;
11252  save_user_flags_line(v);
11253  write_bool_vector(mn_tria_line_user_flags_begin,
11254  v,
11255  mn_tria_line_user_flags_end,
11256  out);
11257 }
11258 
11259 
11260 
11261 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11262 void
11263 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_flags_line(std::istream &in)
11264 {
11265  std::vector<bool> v;
11266  read_bool_vector(mn_tria_line_user_flags_begin,
11267  v,
11268  mn_tria_line_user_flags_end,
11269  in);
11270  load_user_flags_line(v);
11271 }
11272 
11273 
11274 
11275 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11276 void
11277 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_flags_line(const std::vector<bool> &v)
11278 {
11279  Assert(v.size() == n_lines(), ExcGridReadError());
11280 
11281  line_iterator line = begin_line(), endl = end_line();
11282  std::vector<bool>::const_iterator i = v.begin();
11283  for (; line != endl; ++line, ++i)
11284  if (*i == true)
11285  line->set_user_flag();
11286  else
11287  line->clear_user_flag();
11288 
11289  Assert(i == v.end(), ExcInternalError());
11290 }
11291 
11292 
11293 namespace
11294 {
11295  template <typename Iterator>
11296  bool
11297  get_user_flag(const Iterator &i)
11298  {
11299  return i->user_flag_set();
11300  }
11301 
11302 
11303 
11304  template <int structdim, int dim, int spacedim>
11305  bool
11306  get_user_flag(const TriaIterator<InvalidAccessor<structdim, dim, spacedim>> &)
11307  {
11308  Assert(false, ExcInternalError());
11309  return false;
11310  }
11311

11316  set_user_flag(const Iterator &i)
11317  {
11318  i->set_user_flag();
11319  }

11321 
11322 
11323  template <int structdim, int dim, int spacedim>
11324  void
11325  set_user_flag(const TriaIterator<InvalidAccessor<structdim, dim, spacedim>> &)
11326  {
11327  Assert(false, ExcInternalError());
11328  }
11329

11331 
11332  template <typename Iterator>
11333  void
11334  clear_user_flag(const Iterator &i)
11335  {
11336  i->clear_user_flag();
11337  }

11340 
11341  template <int structdim, int dim, int spacedim>

11346  Assert(false, ExcInternalError());
11347  }

11350 
11351 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11352 void
11353 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_flags_quad(std::vector<bool> &v) const
11354 {
11355  v.resize(n_quads(), false);
11356 
11357  if (dim >= 2)
11358  {
11359  std::vector<bool>::iterator i = v.begin();
11360  quad_iterator quad = begin_quad(), endq = end_quad();
11361  for (; quad != endq; ++quad, ++i)
11362  *i = get_user_flag(quad);
11363 
11364  Assert(i == v.end(), ExcInternalError());
11365  }
11366 }
11367 
11368 
11369 
11370 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11371 void
11372 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_flags_quad(std::ostream &out) const
11373 {
11374  std::vector<bool> v;
11375  save_user_flags_quad(v);
11376  write_bool_vector(mn_tria_quad_user_flags_begin,
11377  v,
11378  mn_tria_quad_user_flags_end,
11379  out);
11380 }

11385 void
11386 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_flags_quad(std::istream &in)
11387 {
11388  std::vector<bool> v;
11389  read_bool_vector(mn_tria_quad_user_flags_begin,
11390  v,
11391  mn_tria_quad_user_flags_end,
11392  in);
11393  load_user_flags_quad(v);
11394 }

11398 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11399 void
11400 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_flags_quad(const std::vector<bool> &v)
11401 {
11402  Assert(v.size() == n_quads(), ExcGridReadError());
11403 
11404  if (dim >= 2)
11405  {
11406  quad_iterator quad = begin_quad(), endq = end_quad();
11407  std::vector<bool>::const_iterator i = v.begin();
11408  for (; quad != endq; ++quad, ++i)
11409  if (*i == true)
11410  set_user_flag(quad);
11411  else
11412  clear_user_flag(quad);
11413 
11414  Assert(i == v.end(), ExcInternalError());
11415  }
11416 }

11420 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11421 void
11422 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_flags_hex(std::vector<bool> &v) const
11423 {
11424  v.resize(n_hexs(), false);
11425 
11426  if (dim >= 3)
11427  {
11428  std::vector<bool>::iterator i = v.begin();
11429  hex_iterator hex = begin_hex(), endh = end_hex();
11430  for (; hex != endh; ++hex, ++i)
11431  *i = get_user_flag(hex);
11432 
11433  Assert(i == v.end(), ExcInternalError());
11434  }
11435 }

11442 {

11444  save_user_flags_hex(v);
11445  write_bool_vector(mn_tria_hex_user_flags_begin,
11446  v,
11447  mn_tria_hex_user_flags_end,
11448  out);

11468 void
11469 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_flags_hex(const std::vector<bool> &v)
11470 {
11471  Assert(v.size() == n_hexs(), ExcGridReadError());
11472 
11473  if (dim >= 3)
11474  {
11475  hex_iterator hex = begin_hex(), endh = end_hex();
11476  std::vector<bool>::const_iterator i = v.begin();
11477  for (; hex != endh; ++hex, ++i)
11478  if (*i == true)
11479  set_user_flag(hex);
11480  else
11481  clear_user_flag(hex);
11482 
11483  Assert(i == v.end(), ExcInternalError());
11484  }
11485 }

11489 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11490 void
11491 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_indices(
11492  std::vector<unsigned int> &v) const
11493 {
11494  // clear vector and append all the
11495  // stuff later on
11496  v.clear();
11497 
11498  std::vector<unsigned int> tmp;
11499 
11500  save_user_indices_line(tmp);
11501  v.insert(v.end(), tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
11502 
11503  if (dim >= 2)
11504  {
11505  save_user_indices_quad(tmp);
11506  v.insert(v.end(), tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
11507  }
11508 
11509  if (dim >= 3)
11510  {
11511  save_user_indices_hex(tmp);
11512  v.insert(v.end(), tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
11513  }
11514 
11515  if (dim >= 4)
11516  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
11517 }
11518 
11519 
11520 
11521 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11522 void
11523 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_indices(
11524  const std::vector<unsigned int> &v)
11525 {
11526  Assert(v.size() == n_lines() + n_quads() + n_hexs(), ExcInternalError());
11527  std::vector<unsigned int> tmp;
11528 
11529  // first extract the indices
11530  // belonging to lines
11531  tmp.insert(tmp.end(), v.begin(), v.begin() + n_lines());
11532  // and set the lines
11533  load_user_indices_line(tmp);
11534 
11535  if (dim >= 2)
11536  {
11537  tmp.clear();
11538  tmp.insert(tmp.end(),
11539  v.begin() + n_lines(),
11540  v.begin() + n_lines() + n_quads());
11541  load_user_indices_quad(tmp);
11542  }
11543 
11544  if (dim >= 3)
11545  {
11546  tmp.clear();
11547  tmp.insert(tmp.end(),
11548  v.begin() + n_lines() + n_quads(),
11549  v.begin() + n_lines() + n_quads() + n_hexs());
11550  load_user_indices_hex(tmp);
11551  }
11552 
11553  if (dim >= 4)
11554  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
11555 }

11601 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11602 void
11603 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_indices_line(
11604  std::vector<unsigned int> &v) const
11605 {
11606  v.resize(n_lines(), 0);
11607  std::vector<unsigned int>::iterator i = v.begin();
11608  line_iterator line = begin_line(), endl = end_line();
11609  for (; line != endl; ++line, ++i)
11610  *i = line->user_index();
11611 }

11613 
11614 
11615 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11616 void
11617 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_indices_line(
11618  const std::vector<unsigned int> &v)
11619 {
11620  Assert(v.size() == n_lines(), ExcGridReadError());
11621 
11622  line_iterator line = begin_line(), endl = end_line();
11623  std::vector<unsigned int>::const_iterator i = v.begin();
11624  for (; line != endl; ++line, ++i)
11625  line->set_user_index(*i);
11626 }

11629 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11630 void
11631 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_indices_quad(
11632  std::vector<unsigned int> &v) const
11633 {
11634  v.resize(n_quads(), 0);
11635 
11636  if (dim >= 2)
11637  {
11638  std::vector<unsigned int>::iterator i = v.begin();
11639  quad_iterator quad = begin_quad(), endq = end_quad();
11640  for (; quad != endq; ++quad, ++i)
11641  *i = get_user_index(quad);
11642  }
11643 }

11646 
11647 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11648 void
11649 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_indices_quad(
11650  const std::vector<unsigned int> &v)
11651 {
11652  Assert(v.size() == n_quads(), ExcGridReadError());
11653 
11654  if (dim >= 2)
11655  {
11656  quad_iterator quad = begin_quad(), endq = end_quad();
11657  std::vector<unsigned int>::const_iterator i = v.begin();
11658  for (; quad != endq; ++quad, ++i)
11659  set_user_index(quad, *i);
11660  }
11661 }

11674  hex_iterator hex = begin_hex(), endh = end_hex();
11675  for (; hex != endh; ++hex, ++i)
11676  *i = get_user_index(hex);
11677  }

11688

11690  {

11692  std::vector<unsigned int>::const_iterator i = v.begin();
11693  for (; hex != endh; ++hex, ++i)

11744 
11745 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11746 void
11747 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_pointers(std::vector<void *> &v) const
11748 {
11749  // clear vector and append all the
11750  // stuff later on
11751  v.clear();
11752 
11753  std::vector<void *> tmp;
11754 
11755  save_user_pointers_line(tmp);
11756  v.insert(v.end(), tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
11757 
11758  if (dim >= 2)
11759  {
11760  save_user_pointers_quad(tmp);
11761  v.insert(v.end(), tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
11762  }
11763 
11764  if (dim >= 3)
11765  {
11766  save_user_pointers_hex(tmp);
11767  v.insert(v.end(), tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
11768  }
11769 
11770  if (dim >= 4)
11771  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
11772 }
11773 
11774 
11775 
11776 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11777 void
11778 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_pointers(const std::vector<void *> &v)
11779 {
11780  Assert(v.size() == n_lines() + n_quads() + n_hexs(), ExcInternalError());
11781  std::vector<void *> tmp;
11782 
11783  // first extract the pointers
11784  // belonging to lines
11785  tmp.insert(tmp.end(), v.begin(), v.begin() + n_lines());
11786  // and set the lines
11787  load_user_pointers_line(tmp);
11788 
11789  if (dim >= 2)
11790  {
11791  tmp.clear();
11792  tmp.insert(tmp.end(),
11793  v.begin() + n_lines(),
11794  v.begin() + n_lines() + n_quads());
11795  load_user_pointers_quad(tmp);
11796  }
11797 
11798  if (dim >= 3)
11799  {
11800  tmp.clear();
11801  tmp.insert(tmp.end(),
11802  v.begin() + n_lines() + n_quads(),
11803  v.begin() + n_lines() + n_quads() + n_hexs());
11804  load_user_pointers_hex(tmp);
11805  }
11806 
11807  if (dim >= 4)
11808  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
11809 }
11810 
11811 
11812 
11813 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11814 void
11815 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_pointers_line(
11816  std::vector<void *> &v) const
11817 {
11818  v.resize(n_lines(), nullptr);
11819  std::vector<void *>::iterator i = v.begin();
11820  line_iterator line = begin_line(), endl = end_line();
11821  for (; line != endl; ++line, ++i)
11822  *i = line->user_pointer();
11823 }
11824 
11825 
11826 
11827 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11828 void
11829 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_pointers_line(
11830  const std::vector<void *> &v)
11831 {
11832  Assert(v.size() == n_lines(), ExcGridReadError());
11833 
11834  line_iterator line = begin_line(), endl = end_line();
11835  std::vector<void *>::const_iterator i = v.begin();
11836  for (; line != endl; ++line, ++i)
11837  line->set_user_pointer(*i);
11838 }
11839 
11840 
11841 
11842 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11843 void
11844 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_pointers_quad(
11845  std::vector<void *> &v) const
11846 {
11847  v.resize(n_quads(), nullptr);
11848 
11849  if (dim >= 2)
11850  {
11851  std::vector<void *>::iterator i = v.begin();
11852  quad_iterator quad = begin_quad(), endq = end_quad();
11853  for (; quad != endq; ++quad, ++i)
11854  *i = get_user_pointer(quad);
11855  }
11856 }
11857 
11858 
11859 
11860 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11861 void
11862 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_pointers_quad(
11863  const std::vector<void *> &v)
11864 {
11865  Assert(v.size() == n_quads(), ExcGridReadError());
11866 
11867  if (dim >= 2)
11868  {
11869  quad_iterator quad = begin_quad(), endq = end_quad();
11870  std::vector<void *>::const_iterator i = v.begin();
11871  for (; quad != endq; ++quad, ++i)
11872  set_user_pointer(quad, *i);
11873  }
11874 }
11875 
11876 
11877 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11878 void
11879 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::save_user_pointers_hex(
11880  std::vector<void *> &v) const
11881 {
11882  v.resize(n_hexs(), nullptr);
11883 
11884  if (dim >= 3)
11885  {
11886  std::vector<void *>::iterator i = v.begin();
11887  hex_iterator hex = begin_hex(), endh = end_hex();
11888  for (; hex != endh; ++hex, ++i)
11889  *i = get_user_pointer(hex);
11890  }
11891 }
11892 
11893 
11894 
11895 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11896 void
11897 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::load_user_pointers_hex(
11898  const std::vector<void *> &v)
11899 {
11900  Assert(v.size() == n_hexs(), ExcGridReadError());
11901 
11902  if (dim >= 3)
11903  {
11904  hex_iterator hex = begin_hex(), endh = end_hex();
11905  std::vector<void *>::const_iterator i = v.begin();
11906  for (; hex != endh; ++hex, ++i)
11907  set_user_pointer(hex, *i);
11908  }
11909 }
11910 
11911 
11912 
11913 /*------------------------ Cell iterator functions ------------------------*/
11914 
11915 
11916 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11917 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::raw_cell_iterator
11918 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_raw(const unsigned int level) const
11919 {
11920  switch (dim)
11921  {
11922  case 1:
11923  return begin_raw_line(level);
11924  case 2:
11925  return begin_raw_quad(level);
11926  case 3:
11927  return begin_raw_hex(level);
11928  default:
11929  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
11930  return raw_cell_iterator();
11931  }
11932 }
11933 
11934 
11935 
11936 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11937 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator
11938 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin(const unsigned int level) const
11939 {
11940  switch (dim)
11941  {
11942  case 1:
11943  return begin_line(level);
11944  case 2:
11945  return begin_quad(level);
11946  case 3:
11947  return begin_hex(level);
11948  default:
11949  Assert(false, ExcImpossibleInDim(dim));
11950  return cell_iterator();
11951  }
11952 }
11953 
11954 
11955 
11956 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11957 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator
11958 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_active(const unsigned int level) const
11959 {
11960  switch (dim)
11961  {
11962  case 1:
11963  return begin_active_line(level);
11964  case 2:
11965  return begin_active_quad(level);
11966  case 3:
11967  return begin_active_hex(level);
11968  default:
11969  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
11970  return active_cell_iterator();
11971  }
11972 }
11973 
11974 
11975 
11976 template <int dim, int spacedim>
11977 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator
11978 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::last() const
11979 {
11980  const unsigned int level = levels.size() - 1;
11981  if (levels[level]->cells.n_objects() == 0)
11982  return end(level);
11983 
11984  // find the last raw iterator on
11985  // this level
11986  raw_cell_iterator ri(const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this),
11987  level,
11988  levels[level]->cells.n_objects() - 1);
11989 
11990  // then move to the last used one
11991  if (ri->used() == true)
11992  return ri;
11993  while ((--ri).state() == IteratorState::valid)
11994  if (ri->used() == true)
11995  return ri;
11996  return ri;
11997 }
11998 
11999 
12000 
12001 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12002 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator
12003 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::last_active() const
12004 {
12005  // get the last used cell
12006  cell_iterator cell = last();
12007 
12008  if (cell != end())
12009  {
12010  // then move to the last active one
12011  if (cell->is_active() == true)
12012  return cell;
12013  while ((--cell).state() == IteratorState::valid)
12014  if (cell->is_active() == true)
12015  return cell;
12016  }
12017  return cell;
12018 }
12019 
12020 
12021 
12022 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12023 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator
12024 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::create_cell_iterator(const CellId &cell_id) const
12025 {
12026  cell_iterator cell(
12027  this, 0, coarse_cell_id_to_coarse_cell_index(cell_id.get_coarse_cell_id()));
12028 
12029  for (const auto &child_index : cell_id.get_child_indices())
12030  {
12031  Assert(
12032  cell->has_children(),
12033  ExcMessage(
12034  "CellId is invalid for this triangulation.\n"
12035  "Either the provided CellId does not correspond to a cell in this "
12036  "triangulation object, or, in case you are using a parallel "
12037  "triangulation, may correspond to an artificial cell that is less "
12038  "refined on this processor."));
12039  cell = cell->child(static_cast<unsigned int>(child_index));
12040  }
12041 
12042  return cell;
12043 }
12044 
12045 
12046 
12047 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12048 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator
12049 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::end() const
12050 {
12051  return cell_iterator(const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this),
12052  -1,
12053  -1);
12054 }
12055 
12056 
12057 
12058 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12059 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::raw_cell_iterator
12060 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::end_raw(const unsigned int level) const
12061 {
12062  // This function may be called on parallel triangulations on levels
12063  // that exist globally, but not on the local portion of the
12064  // triangulation. In that case, just return the end iterator.
12065  //
12066  // We need to use levels.size() instead of n_levels() because the
12067  // latter function uses the cache, but we need to be able to call
12068  // this function at a time when the cache is not currently up to
12069  // date.
12070  if (level >= levels.size())
12071  {
12072  Assert(level < n_global_levels(),
12073  ExcInvalidLevel(level, n_global_levels()));
12074  return end();
12075  }
12076 
12077  // Query whether the given level is valid for the local portion of the
12078  // triangulation.
12079  Assert(level < levels.size(), ExcInvalidLevel(level, levels.size()));
12080  if (level < levels.size() - 1)
12081  return begin_raw(level + 1);
12082  else
12083  return end();
12084 }
12085 
12086 
12087 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12088 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator
12089 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::end(const unsigned int level) const
12090 {
12091  // This function may be called on parallel triangulations on levels
12092  // that exist globally, but not on the local portion of the
12093  // triangulation. In that case, just retrn the end iterator.
12094  //
12095  // We need to use levels.size() instead of n_levels() because the
12096  // latter function uses the cache, but we need to be able to call
12097  // this function at a time when the cache is not currently up to
12098  // date.
12099  if (level >= levels.size())
12100  {
12101  Assert(level < n_global_levels(),
12102  ExcInvalidLevel(level, n_global_levels()));
12103  return end();
12104  }
12105 
12106  // Query whether the given level is valid for the local portion of the
12107  // triangulation.
12108  Assert(level < levels.size(), ExcInvalidLevel(level, levels.size()));
12109  if (level < levels.size() - 1)
12110  return begin(level + 1);
12111  else
12112  return end();
12113 }
12114 
12115 
12116 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12117 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator
12118 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::end_active(const unsigned int level) const
12119 {
12120  // This function may be called on parallel triangulations on levels
12121  // that exist globally, but not on the local portion of the
12122  // triangulation. In that case, just return the end iterator.
12123  //
12124  // We need to use levels.size() instead of n_levels() because the
12125  // latter function uses the cache, but we need to be able to call
12126  // this function at a time when the cache is not currently up to
12127  // date.
12128  if (level >= levels.size())
12129  {
12130  Assert(level < n_global_levels(),
12131  ExcInvalidLevel(level, n_global_levels()));
12132  return end();
12133  }
12134 
12135  // Query whether the given level is valid for the local portion of the
12136  // triangulation.
12137  Assert(level < levels.size(), ExcInvalidLevel(level, levels.size()));
12138  return (level >= levels.size() - 1 ? active_cell_iterator(end()) :
12139  begin_active(level + 1));
12140 }
12141 
12142 
12143 
12144 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12145 IteratorRange<typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator>
12146 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterators() const
12147 {
12148  return IteratorRange<typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator>(
12149  begin(), end());
12150 }
12151 
12152 
12153 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12154 IteratorRange<typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator>
12155 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterators() const
12156 {
12157  return IteratorRange<
12158  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator>(begin_active(),
12159  end());
12160 }
12161 
12162 
12163 
12164 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12165 IteratorRange<typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator>
12166 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterators_on_level(
12167  const unsigned int level) const
12168 {
12169  return IteratorRange<typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator>(
12170  begin(level), end(level));
12171 }
12172 
12173 
12174 
12175 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12176 IteratorRange<typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator>
12177 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterators_on_level(
12178  const unsigned int level) const
12179 {
12180  return IteratorRange<
12181  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator>(
12182  begin_active(level), end_active(level));
12183 }
12184 
12185 
12186 /*------------------------ Face iterator functions ------------------------*/
12187 
12188 
12189 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12190 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::face_iterator
12191 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_face() const
12192 {
12193  switch (dim)
12194  {
12195  case 1:
12196  Assert(false, ExcImpossibleInDim(1));
12197  return raw_face_iterator();
12198  case 2:
12199  return begin_line();
12200  case 3:
12201  return begin_quad();
12202  default:
12203  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
12204  return face_iterator();
12205  }
12206 }
12207 
12208 
12209 
12210 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12211 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_face_iterator
12212 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_active_face() const
12213 {
12214  switch (dim)
12215  {
12216  case 1:
12217  Assert(false, ExcImpossibleInDim(1));
12218  return raw_face_iterator();
12219  case 2:
12220  return begin_active_line();
12221  case 3:
12222  return begin_active_quad();
12223  default:
12224  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
12225  return active_face_iterator();
12226  }
12227 }
12228 
12229 
12230 
12231 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12232 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::face_iterator
12233 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::end_face() const
12234 {
12235  switch (dim)
12236  {
12237  case 1:
12238  Assert(false, ExcImpossibleInDim(1));
12239  return raw_face_iterator();
12240  case 2:
12241  return end_line();
12242  case 3:
12243  return end_quad();
12244  default:
12245  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
12246  return raw_face_iterator();
12247  }
12248 }
12249 
12250 
12251 
12252 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12253 IteratorRange<typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_face_iterator>
12254 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_face_iterators() const
12255 {
12256  return IteratorRange<
12257  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_face_iterator>(
12258  begin_active_face(), end_face());
12259 }
12260 
12261 /*------------------------ Vertex iterator functions ------------------------*/
12262 
12263 
12264 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12265 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::vertex_iterator
12266 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_vertex() const
12267 {
12268  vertex_iterator i =
12269  raw_vertex_iterator(const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this), 0, 0);
12270  if (i.state() != IteratorState::valid)
12271  return i;
12272  // This loop will end because every triangulation has used vertices.
12273  while (i->used() == false)
12274  if ((++i).state() != IteratorState::valid)
12275  return i;
12276  return i;
12277 }
12278 
12279 
12280 
12281 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12282 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_vertex_iterator
12283 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_active_vertex() const
12284 {
12285  // every vertex is active
12286  return begin_vertex();
12287 }
12288 
12289 
12290 
12291 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12292 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::vertex_iterator
12293 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::end_vertex() const
12294 {
12295  return raw_vertex_iterator(const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this),
12296  -1,
12297  numbers::invalid_unsigned_int);
12298 }
12299 
12300 
12301 
12302 /*------------------------ Line iterator functions ------------------------*/
12303 
12304 
12305 
12306 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12307 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::raw_line_iterator
12308 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_raw_line(const unsigned int level) const
12309 {
12310  // This function may be called on parallel triangulations on levels
12311  // that exist globally, but not on the local portion of the
12312  // triangulation. In that case, just return the end iterator.
12313  //
12314  // We need to use levels.size() instead of n_levels() because the
12315  // latter function uses the cache, but we need to be able to call
12316  // this function at a time when the cache is not currently up to
12317  // date.
12318  if (level >= levels.size())
12319  {
12320  Assert(level < n_global_levels(),
12321  ExcInvalidLevel(level, n_global_levels()));
12322  return end_line();
12323  }
12324 
12325  switch (dim)
12326  {
12327  case 1:
12328  // Query whether the given level is valid for the local portion of the
12329  // triangulation.
12330  Assert(level < levels.size(), ExcInvalidLevel(level, levels.size()));
12331 
12332  if (level >= levels.size() || levels[level]->cells.n_objects() == 0)
12333  return end_line();
12334 
12335  return raw_line_iterator(
12336  const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this), level, 0);
12337 
12338  default:
12339  Assert(level == 0, ExcFacesHaveNoLevel());
12340  return raw_line_iterator(
12341  const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this), 0, 0);
12342  }
12343 }
12344 
12345 
12346 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12347 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::line_iterator
12348 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_line(const unsigned int level) const
12349 {
12350  // level is checked in begin_raw
12351  raw_line_iterator ri = begin_raw_line(level);
12352  if (ri.state() != IteratorState::valid)
12353  return ri;
12354  while (ri->used() == false)
12355  if ((++ri).state() != IteratorState::valid)
12356  return ri;
12357  return ri;
12358 }
12359 
12360 
12361 
12362 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12363 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_line_iterator
12364 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_active_line(const unsigned int level) const
12365 {
12366  // level is checked in begin_raw
12367  line_iterator i = begin_line(level);
12368  if (i.state() != IteratorState::valid)
12369  return i;
12370  while (i->has_children())
12371  if ((++i).state() != IteratorState::valid)
12372  return i;
12373  return i;
12374 }
12375 
12376 
12377 
12378 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12379 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::line_iterator
12380 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::end_line() const
12381 {
12382  return raw_line_iterator(const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this),
12383  -1,
12384  -1);
12385 }
12386 
12387 
12388 
12389 /*------------------------ Quad iterator functions ------------------------*/
12390 
12391 
12392 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12393 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::raw_quad_iterator
12394 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_raw_quad(const unsigned int level) const
12395 {
12396  // This function may be called on parallel triangulations on levels
12397  // that exist globally, but not on the local portion of the
12398  // triangulation. In that case, just return the end iterator.
12399  //
12400  // We need to use levels.size() instead of n_levels() because the
12401  // latter function uses the cache, but we need to be able to call
12402  // this function at a time when the cache is not currently up to
12403  // date.
12404  if (level >= levels.size())
12405  {
12406  Assert(level < n_global_levels(),
12407  ExcInvalidLevel(level, n_global_levels()));
12408  return end_quad();
12409  }
12410 
12411  switch (dim)
12412  {
12413  case 1:
12414  Assert(false, ExcImpossibleInDim(1));
12415  return raw_hex_iterator();
12416  case 2:
12417  {
12418  // Query whether the given level is valid for the local portion of the
12419  // triangulation.
12420  Assert(level < levels.size(), ExcInvalidLevel(level, levels.size()));
12421 
12422  if (level >= levels.size() || levels[level]->cells.n_objects() == 0)
12423  return end_quad();
12424 
12425  return raw_quad_iterator(
12426  const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this), level, 0);
12427  }
12428 
12429  case 3:
12430  {
12431  Assert(level == 0, ExcFacesHaveNoLevel());
12432 
12433  return raw_quad_iterator(
12434  const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this), 0, 0);
12435  }
12436 
12437 
12438  default:
12439  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
12440  return raw_hex_iterator();
12441  }
12442 }
12443 
12444 
12445 
12446 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12447 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::quad_iterator
12448 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_quad(const unsigned int level) const
12449 {
12450  // level is checked in begin_raw
12451  raw_quad_iterator ri = begin_raw_quad(level);
12452  if (ri.state() != IteratorState::valid)
12453  return ri;
12454  while (ri->used() == false)
12455  if ((++ri).state() != IteratorState::valid)
12456  return ri;
12457  return ri;
12458 }
12459 
12460 
12461 
12462 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12463 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_quad_iterator
12464 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_active_quad(const unsigned int level) const
12465 {
12466  // level is checked in begin_raw
12467  quad_iterator i = begin_quad(level);
12468  if (i.state() != IteratorState::valid)
12469  return i;
12470  while (i->has_children())
12471  if ((++i).state() != IteratorState::valid)
12472  return i;
12473  return i;
12474 }
12475 
12476 
12477 
12478 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12479 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::quad_iterator
12480 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::end_quad() const
12481 {
12482  return raw_quad_iterator(const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this),
12483  -1,
12484  -1);
12485 }
12486 
12487 
12488 /*------------------------ Hex iterator functions ------------------------*/
12489 
12490 
12491 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12492 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::raw_hex_iterator
12493 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_raw_hex(const unsigned int level) const
12494 {
12495  // This function may be called on parallel triangulations on levels
12496  // that exist globally, but not on the local portion of the
12497  // triangulation. In that case, just return the end iterator.
12498  //
12499  // We need to use levels.size() instead of n_levels() because the
12500  // latter function uses the cache, but we need to be able to call
12501  // this function at a time when the cache is not currently up to
12502  // date.
12503  if (level >= levels.size())
12504  {
12505  Assert(level < n_global_levels(),
12506  ExcInvalidLevel(level, n_global_levels()));
12507  return end_hex();
12508  }
12509 
12510  switch (dim)
12511  {
12512  case 1:
12513  case 2:
12514  Assert(false, ExcImpossibleInDim(1));
12515  return raw_hex_iterator();
12516  case 3:
12517  {
12518  // Query whether the given level is valid for the local portion of the
12519  // triangulation.
12520  Assert(level < levels.size(), ExcInvalidLevel(level, levels.size()));
12521 
12522  if (level >= levels.size() || levels[level]->cells.n_objects() == 0)
12523  return end_hex();
12524 
12525  return raw_hex_iterator(
12526  const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this), level, 0);
12527  }
12528 
12529  default:
12530  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
12531  return raw_hex_iterator();
12532  }
12533 }
12534 
12535 
12536 
12537 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12538 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::hex_iterator
12539 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_hex(const unsigned int level) const
12540 {
12541  // level is checked in begin_raw
12542  raw_hex_iterator ri = begin_raw_hex(level);
12543  if (ri.state() != IteratorState::valid)
12544  return ri;
12545  while (ri->used() == false)
12546  if ((++ri).state() != IteratorState::valid)
12547  return ri;
12548  return ri;
12549 }
12550 
12551 
12552 
12553 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12554 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_hex_iterator
12555 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::begin_active_hex(const unsigned int level) const
12556 {
12557  // level is checked in begin_raw
12558  hex_iterator i = begin_hex(level);
12559  if (i.state() != IteratorState::valid)
12560  return i;
12561  while (i->has_children())
12562  if ((++i).state() != IteratorState::valid)
12563  return i;
12564  return i;
12565 }
12566 
12567 
12568 
12569 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12570 typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::hex_iterator
12571 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::end_hex() const
12572 {
12573  return raw_hex_iterator(const_cast<Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(this),
12574  -1,
12575  -1);
12576 }
12577 
12578 
12579 
12580 // -------------------------------- number of cells etc ---------------
12581 
12582 
12583 namespace internal
12584 {
12585  namespace TriangulationImplementation
12586  {
12587  inline unsigned int
12588  n_cells(const internal::TriangulationImplementation::NumberCache<1> &c)
12589  {
12590  return c.n_lines;
12591  }
12592 
12593 
12594  inline unsigned int
12595  n_active_cells(
12596  const internal::TriangulationImplementation::NumberCache<1> &c)
12597  {
12598  return c.n_active_lines;
12599  }
12600 
12601 
12602  inline unsigned int
12603  n_cells(const internal::TriangulationImplementation::NumberCache<2> &c)
12604  {
12605  return c.n_quads;
12606  }
12607 
12608 
12609  inline unsigned int
12610  n_active_cells(
12611  const internal::TriangulationImplementation::NumberCache<2> &c)
12612  {
12613  return c.n_active_quads;
12614  }
12615 
12616 
12617  inline unsigned int
12618  n_cells(const internal::TriangulationImplementation::NumberCache<3> &c)
12619  {
12620  return c.n_hexes;
12621  }
12622 
12623 
12624  inline unsigned int
12625  n_active_cells(
12626  const internal::TriangulationImplementation::NumberCache<3> &c)
12627  {
12628  return c.n_active_hexes;
12629  }
12630  } // namespace TriangulationImplementation
12631 } // namespace internal
12632

12636 unsigned int
12637 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::n_cells() const
12638 {
12639  return internal::TriangulationImplementation::n_cells(number_cache);
12640 }
12641 
12642

12644 unsigned int
12645 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::n_active_cells() const
12646 {
12647  return internal::TriangulationImplementation::n_active_cells(number_cache);
12648 }
12649 
12650 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12651 types::global_cell_index
12652 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::n_global_active_cells() const
12653 {
12654  return n_active_cells();
12655 }
12656 
12657 
12658 
12659 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12660 unsigned int
12661 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::n_faces() const
12662 {
12663  switch (dim)
12664  {
12665  case 1:
12666  return n_used_vertices();
12667  case 2:
12668  return n_lines();
12669  case 3:
12670  return n_quads();
12671  default:
12672  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
12673  }
12674  return 0;
12675 }
12676 
12677 
12678 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12679 unsigned int
12680 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::n_raw_faces() const
12681 {
12682  switch (dim)
12683  {
12684  case 1:
12685  return n_vertices();
12686  case 2:
12687  return n_raw_lines();
12688  case 3:
12689  return n_raw_quads();
12690  default:
12691  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
12692  }
12693  return 0;
12694 }
12695 
12696 
12697 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12698 unsigned int
12699 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::n_active_faces() const
12700 {
12701  switch (dim)
12702  {
12703  case 1:
12704  return n_used_vertices();
12705  case 2:
12706  return n_active_lines();
12707  case 3:
12708  return n_active_quads();
12709  default:
12710  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
12711  }
12712  return 0;
12713 }
12714 
12715 
12716 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12717 unsigned int
12718 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::n_raw_cells(const unsigned int level) const
12719 {
12720  switch (dim)
12721  {
12722  case 1:
12723  return n_raw_lines(level);
12724  case 2:
12725  return n_raw_quads(level);
12726  case 3:
12727  return n_raw_hexs(level);
12728  default:
12729  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
12730  }
12731  return 0;
12732 }
12733

12739 {
12740  switch (dim)

12742  case 1:

12744  case 2:
12745  return n_quads(level);
12746  case 3:
12747  return n_hexs(level);
12748  default:
12749  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
12750  }
12751  return 0;
12752 }

12770  }

12774 
12775 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12776 bool
12777 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::has_hanging_nodes() const
12778 {
12779  for (unsigned int lvl = 0; lvl < n_global_levels() - 1; lvl++)
12780  if (n_active_cells(lvl) != 0)
12781  return true;
12782 
12783  return false;
12784 }

12795 
12796 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12797 unsigned int
12798 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::n_raw_lines(const unsigned int level) const
12799 {
12800  if (dim == 1)
12801  {
12802  AssertIndexRange(level, n_levels());
12803  return levels[level]->cells.n_objects();
12804  }
12805 
12806  Assert(false, ExcFacesHaveNoLevel());
12807  return 0;
12808 }
12809 
12810 
12811 template <int dim, int spacedim>
12812 unsigned int
12813 Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::n_raw_lines() const
12814 {
12815  if (dim == 1)
12816  {
12817  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
12818  return 0;
12819  }
12820 
12821  return faces->lines.n_objects();
12822 }
12823 
12824

12828 {
12829  AssertIndexRange(level, number_cache.n_lines_level.size());
12830  Assert(dim == 1, ExcFacesHaveNoLevel());
12831  return number_cache.n_lines_level[level];
12832 }
